name: Sheraton Ottawa Hotel

reviews.text: I stayed one night at the Sheraton. I had not heard much about the hotel so I was a little hesitant, The location is excellent . Right downtown and a 10 minute walk to the market area . Very friendly and accomodating staff. Great bar. Good sized room . I did not here another person all night.
reviews.title: GOOD LOCATION
Usual Sheraton Service
reviews.text: Good Central Location in Ottawa. When booking in with my kids the bell boy offered crayons and a colouring book for them. Upgraded me to a SPG floor. Valet parking was good as I called for my car several times and it was brought around in less then 10min. My kids and I had the pool and sauna to ourselves. Room service pirces are resonable and thay have a 30min guaranty. Will stay again and recomend.

Even though the majority of the hotel staff was on strike, our stay was very nice. Even though the management staff worked double-duty during the strike, (acting as bartender and restaurant manager) we didn't have to worry about anything. My room was clean, nice, comfortable. The location was perfect for our business needs and within walking distance of several great restaurants and nightlife. I would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Pretty nice

reviews.text: This is a very clean hotel, right downtown in the business district. Valet parking. Nice room to use computers & printer etc. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The place was clean and pleasant. Nice comfy bed.
reviews.title: Nice clean hotel

reviews.text: The only think I didn't like was the TV set-up. You can't surf from station to station - but have to go back to the main menu over and over again to see what is on various channels - I HATED that! I suppose its a way to entice you to buy a movie.
reviews.title: Exceeded Expectations

reviews.text: My husband and I just wanted to hide out in the city for the weekend, relax, stroll around.... the Sheraton was perfect. Great location very near to the canal, parliament buildings, the market, etc.
reviews.title: Comfortable, Quiet, Clean & Sweet sleeper!

reviews.text: The rooms were very large (every Sheraton I've ever stayed at has these extra large, spacious rooms, they're great!). The bathroom was nicely decorated with marble countertops and floors. Only downside of the room would have to be the small tub/shower - it was almost dormitory small. That being said, if all you want to do is have a shower before you head out for the day/night - you'd be just fine.
reviews.title: Renovations complete!
Great location
reviews.text: The beds are the perfect sweet sleepers - really comfortable, we love them!
The staff are very pleasant and accomodating but not at all in your face.
reviews.title: great place to sleep, but lobby and restaurant currently under renovation
My favourite hotel
reviews.text: The valet parking is $15 per 24 hours on weekends, although there is other parking nearby that is free on weekends. We preferred the valet parking as there was less hassle, and excellent service from the valets with in/out privledges.
We stayed at the Sheraton for a few nights in August. The hotel has a great location. The service was friendly inside the hotel. The room was large, but a little dark.
reviews.title: Careful with the Valet Parking- make sure they know how to drive your car

likes.disliked: — Park your own car at a nearby lot instead of using the Valet.

reviews.text: We had taken our car in and out of Valet service each day for 3 days, and didn't have any problems with our car until our last day.
reviews.title: Good Downtown bet

reviews.text: When we were picking up our car from the Valet after checkout, the Valet parked the car a few metres back from where the Valet usually parked the car. We have a BMW that has a key fob, rather than a standard American style car key. The key fob would not click into our ignition properly. It would not stay in the ignition, so we were having difficulty starting the car. We must have been in front of the valet stand, attempting to start the car for over half an hour. There were at least 3 valets nearby, but none of them offered to help us. I finally went inside, and the friendly concierge gave me the contact information for the BMW dealer in Otawa. We finally managed to get the key fob into its slot, and start the ignition, but then it was impossible to remove it. This meant that we were now able to drive, and we'd be able to start and stop the ignition, but the battery would continue to be on if we stopped the ignition.
reviews.title: A Solid Choice!!

reviews.text: When we got to the Ottawa dealership, they were unable to remove the fob, but suggested this may have occured if someone tried to remove the fob by pulling hard to remove the fob from the slot, rather than gently clicking in gently to remove it. They had never seen the problem before, in any of their cars.We ended up deciding to drive home, rather than staying in Ottawa several more nights to wait for the part to arrive at BMW.
reviews.title: Middle of the line Hotel in a good location

likes.liked: — Try AAA rate thru canadian hotels portal for better rate

reviews.title: Excellent location
reviews.text: Once we were at our own dealership, it was discovered that 2 parts were broken inside the slot. They had never seen this problem before. BMW believed this damage was done by someone forcefully pulling the key fob from the slot. Luckily our car was under warranty and it was fixed free of charge.

reviews.title: Renovated - the other reviews are not current anymore!
reviews.text: Not to say that the other reviewers are wrong, but the room I stayed in on the 16th floor - the business class rooms - where renovated. Granted, this is not a new building so things like the heating system reflect old style controls - not a room thermostat - but the hallways are brand new - the room I stayed in included a brand new EXTREMELY COMFORTABLE bed with great linens, a desk with fax/printer, etc. I am not sure if every room has been renovated, but if you ask for a renovated room on the business class floors, you won't be disappointed. A solid Sheraton that exceeded my expectations.

reviews.title: Completely renovated
reviews.text: I have recently returned from a stay in Ottawa and was shocked to read the reviews of the hotel I had stayed in. The only possible explanation is that the reviewers stayed there some time ago. This hotel has been recently remodelled with new beds, linens, and carpets. The rooms were very clean and the staff helpful and courteous. I would recommend it highly and will stay there again.

reviews.title: Fine experience
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Sheraton the weekend of Feb. 14/15, 2004 and had the same wonderful experience we always have for our Winterlude mini-vacation. Staff was courteous, rooms were clean and the prices were reasonable. The only problem we had was a 45 minute wait for our meal on Sat. night.

reviews.title: Avoid it if you can
reviews.text: I go to Ottawa for business quite regularly and have stayed at this hotel many times. It's an extremely old hotel and it shows everywhere.

reviews.title: Does not live up to Sheraton name
reviews.text: The rooms are in desperate need of renovations and are very musty. One time, it was so bad that it got my asthma acting up and it hasn't acted up in years! The beds are horrible, sheets are thin, and pillows are deteriorating. It's not even as good as a Four Points! So, why do I stay here? It's because the location is right behind the office and for getting points on the Starwood program. However, if you have a choice, stay in the Westin Ottawa instead. MUCH better hotel.

description: The Sheraton Ottawa is located in the heart of Canada's capital. Our Ottawa accommodations, featuring newly refreshed guestrooms, are just steps away from several of Ottawa's attractions.
